conclusion: To determine the work done by the gas from state A to state B, analyze the process on the PV diagram.
The process from A to B is an isobaric (constant pressure) expansion.
The pressure remains constant at p = 1 x 10^5 Pa.
The volume changes from V_A = 3 L to V_B = 4 L.
For an isobaric process, the work done by the gas is given by W = p ΔV.
ΔV = V_B - V_A = 4 L - 3 L = 1 L.
Convert the volume change to cubic meters: ΔV = 1 L = 1 x 10^-3 m^3.
Substitute the values into the work formula: W = (1 x 10^5 Pa) x (1 x 10^-3 m^3) = 100 J.
The work done by the gas from state A to state B is 100 J.
